verses.verse: To the chief Musician <WH5329> <WH8764> upon Gittith <WH1665>, A Psalm of Asaph <WH623>. Sing aloud <WH7442> <WH8685> unto 'Elohim <WH430> our strength <WH5797>: make a joyful noise <WH7321> <WH8685> unto the 'Elohim <WH430> of Ya`akov <WH3290>.
Take <WH5375> <WH8798> a psalm <WH2172>, and bring <WH5414> <WH8798> hither the timbrel <WH8596>, the pleasant <WH5273> harp <WH3658> with the psaltery <WH5035>.
Blow up <WH8628> <WH8798> the shofar <WH7782> in the new moon <WH2320>, in the time appointed <WH3677>, on our solemn feast <WH2282> day <WH3117>.
For this was a statute <WH2706> for Yisra'EL <WH3478>, and a Torah <WH4941> of the 'Elohim <WH430> of Ya`akov <WH3290>.

This he ordained <WH7760> <WH8804> in Yosef <WH3084> for a testimony <WH5715>, when he went out <WH3318> <WH8800> through the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>: where I heard <WH8085> <WH8799> a language <WH8193> that I understood <WH3045> <WH8804> not.
I removed <WH5493> <WH8689> his shoulder <WH7926> from the burden <WH5447>: his hands <WH3709> were delivered <WH5674> <WH8799> from the pots <WH1731>.

Thou calledst <WH7121> <WH8804> in trouble <WH6869>, and I delivered <WH2502> <WH8762> thee; I answered <WH6030> <WH8799> thee in the secret place <WH5643> of thunder <WH7482>: I proved <WH974> <WH8799> thee at the waters <WH4325> of Meribah <WH4809>. Selah <WH5542>.
Hear <WH8085> <WH8798>, O my people <WH5971>, and I will testify <WH5749> <WH8686> unto thee: O Yisra'EL <WH3478>, if thou wilt hearken <WH8085> <WH8799> unto me;
There shall no strange <WH2114> <WH8801> god <WH410> be in thee; neither shalt thou worship <WH7812> <WH8691> any strange <WH5236> god <WH410>.

I am the YY <WH3068> thy 'Elohim <WH430>, which brought <WH5927> <WH8688> thee out of the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>: open thy mouth <WH6310> wide <WH7337> <WH8685>, and I will fill <WH4390> <WH8762> it.
But my people <WH5971> would not hearken <WH8085> <WH8804> to my voice <WH6963>; and Yisra'EL <WH3478> would <WH14> <WH8804> none of me.
So I gave them up <WH7971> <WH8762> unto their own hearts <WH3820> ' lust <WH8307>: and they walked <WH3212> <WH8799> in their own counsels <WH4156>.
Oh <WH3863> that my people <WH5971> had hearkened <WH8085> <WH8802> unto me, and Yisra'EL <WH3478> had walked <WH1980> <WH8762> in my ways <WH1870> !
I should soon <WH4592> have subdued <WH3665> <WH8686> their enemies <WH341> <WH8802>, and turned <WH7725> <WH8686> my hand <WH3027> against their adversaries <WH6862>.
The haters <WH8130> <WH8764> of the YY <WH3068> should have submitted <WH3584> <WH8762> themselves unto him: but their time <WH6256> should have endured for ever <WH5769>.
He should have fed <WH398> <WH8686> them also with the finest <WH2459> of the wheat <WH2406>: and with honey <WH1706> out of the rock <WH6697> should I have satisfied <WH7646> <WH8686> thee.
